topics.body:
Speaking of crossdressing for Halloween check this out:
!http://i2.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/858/079/0c5.png!

Also not to get political and to summarize a long ass thing about what I was reading in the nytimes, but basically social conservatism is dying hard right now.

What do I mean by that?  Well essentially to summarize what is happening in the usa right now social conservatives are having a hard ass time getting re-elected right now cause yes republicans are going to take the senate by two or three seats, *BUT* the catch though is that a lot of politicians are having to drop the religious right to get re-elected.  They're still holding the conservative banner, but they're having to drop a lot of rhetoric to remain electable.

What does this mean?  Well it's just a theory, *but* bye bye religious right movement in politics because your candidates either have to drop social conservatism or they're going to lose.

Tl:dr; libertarianism is subtly taking over the republican party cause the religious right's ideologies are no longer electable.

If you're still trying to understand what I mean by this is 2020 it's going to be democrats vs -republicans- libertarians.

Why am I excited even though I'm not a republican?  Cause bye bye anti-gay rights movement and bye bye religious right.
